result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chouader B Yang

records.addlTxt:
1:30 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Chouader B Yang appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Chouader B Yang.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Burdick is heard. Defendant waives time limits for holding Preliminary Hearing. 
State comments on date that witness will return back to the State. 
Attorney Burdick will decide if they will be waiving the preliminary hearing and will let the State know.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:46 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Chouader B Yang appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court states that since the court was notified that def. qualifies for Public Defender (they could not have an attorney present for today) will continue this matter for one to be appointed.
Court advises def. to contact Public Defenders office as soon as this hearing is completed and advise them that if they have an attorney that they can appoint, court will accommodate the attorney's schedule
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender's Office indicates that defendant does qualify for a public defender, however, they will not have anyone to represent him at his hearing on 10/10/2022.

2:03 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Chouader B Yang in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:12 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Chouader B Yang appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant confirms name, defendant gives the court the name Ben that the defendant goes by.  

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond.  State requests that bond be set at $500.00 cash.  Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard.  

Court orders at $500.00 cash.  Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
